# pop()

**Type Method**

Pops the current cursor off the top of the stack.

## Declaration

```swift
class func pop()
```

## Discussion

The new object on the top of the stack becomes the current cursor. If the current cursor is the only cursor on the stack, this method does nothing.

## Controlling which cursor is current

- **pop()**: Sends a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSCursor/pop()-swift.type.method] message to the receiver’s class.
- **push()**: Puts the receiver on top of the cursor stack and makes it the current cursor.
- **set()**: Makes the receiver the current cursor.
